page.title: 16Games played at school
page.content: EGGY-PEGGY Any number of people can play this game. One person is chosen to stand in front of the other people. The other people say "Eggy-peggy what's on telly" to the person in front of them. That person then chooses a subject and the other players have to csecretly choose what they will be. When they have chosen the player at the front lists a number of items concerning the subject. If one of the players has also chosen that item that player must 'fight' the person at the front. In the 'fight' both contestants must stand on one leg and hold hands. Then they push each other around. The first person to put both feet down on the ground is the loser and takes the place of the person at the front. Changing legs is not allowed.
